experiences.name: Academic Internship
experiences.description: Internships connected to a course; students get projects with faculty help and receive course credit. Typically not paid. The Center for Community Based Learning facilitates academic internships.

experiences.name: Paid Internship
experiences.description: Internships offered by companies during the academic year or summer. Students are hired directly by the company. Opportunities are typically advertised by the Career Development Center, Library, and some departments.

experiences.name: Research
experiences.description: Opportunities with faculty, research labs, or agencies to generate new knowledge. Usually paid, especially off-campus. Advertised via Sponsored Programs Foundation, departments, or faculty.

experiences.name: Fellowship
experiences.description: Opportunities offered by faculty members at Cal Poly Humboldt, or other universities, centers and institutes to engage in scholarly and creative activities. Experience is usually paid. Advertised through the Sponsored Programs Foundation, departments, or faculty.

experiences.name: Service Learning
experiences.description: A particular type of academic internship course whose focus is to provide a service to an organization external to campus. The Center for Community Based Learning facilitates service learning courses.

experiences.name: Clinical Placement
experiences.description: A particular type of academic internship course in which students are placed in a clinical setting to gain professional experience. Common for social work majors. The Center for Community Based Learning facilitates clinical placements.

experiences.name: Practicum
experiences.description: A particular type of academic internship course in which students are placed in a professional setting to gain experience. Common for psychology majors. The Center for Community Based Learning facilitates practica.

offices.name: Career Development Center
offices.description: The Career Development Center advertises paid opportunities such as jobs, paid internships, and fellowships through Handshake. They host campus events like the Career Fair and Part-time Job & Volunteer Fair, and offer career advising, resume writing, and job application support to students. Handshake is available for faculty, staff, and external partners to post opportunities.

offices.name: Center for Community Based Learning (CCBL)
offices.description: The Center for Community Based Learning (CCBL) supports and promotes course-based, hands-on learning practices such as internships, practicums, and service learning courses. CCBL assists faculty with course design and community connections, students with community engagement and S4 reporting, and community partners with site approval and opportunity development.

offices.name: Youth Educational Services (YES)
offices.description: Youth Educational Services (Y.E.S.) offers a variety of community-based volunteer opportunities, from large-scale events to semester-long programs. Students can participate in one-day service events, weekly drop-in activities, or semester-long cohorts. Leadership positions and internal scholarships are available for program directors. Some programs are affiliated with a 1-unit course.

offices.name: College Corps
offices.description: College Corps is a service fellowship that provides students with $10,000 in college funding for completing 450 hours of service in education, climate action, or food insecurity. Hours may also count toward service or internship requirements for other courses. College Corps prepares students for their future careers through community service.

offices.name: SPF Engagement Hub
offices.description: The SPF Engagement Hub is a website that showcases externally funded opportunities for students and faculty, including fellowships, research opportunities, and paid internships. All opportunities are tied to existing grants and contracts and change dynamically.

offices.name: Library
offices.description: The Cal Poly Humboldt Library offers several paid, on-campus internship opportunities for students, available year-round. These internships involve research and scholarships, in addition to the Library's core services for the campus community.

definitions.internship: Internships are structured work experiences related to your field of study or career interests.
definitions.research: Research experiences involve working with faculty or labs to generate new knowledge.
definitions.service learning: Service learning combines coursework with meaningful community service.
definitions.shadowing: Job shadowing lets you observe professionals in their work environment.
definitions.paid: Paid opportunities provide financial compensation for your work.
definitions.not paid: Unpaid opportunities do not offer financial compensation.
definitions.on-campus: On-campus experiences take place at Cal Poly Humboldt.
definitions.off-campus: Off-campus experiences occur at external organizations or sites.
definitions.academic year: Academic year opportunities take place during the fall and spring semesters.
definitions.summer: Summer opportunities occur during the summer break.
definitions.course credit: These experiences can be counted toward your degree as academic credit.
